ocaml/tools/ci/inria/main - ocaml

Functions defined

  • arch_error
  • error
  • kill_task
  • quote1

Source code

  1. #!/bin/sh
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*          Damien Doligez, projet Gallium, INRIA Rocquencourt            *
  7. #*                                                                        *
  8. #*   Copyright 2014 Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et     *
  9. #*     en Automatique.                                                    *
  10. #*                                                                        *
  11. #*   All rights reserved.  This file is distributed under the terms of    *
  12. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  13. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  14. #*                                                                        *
  15. #**************************************************************************

  17. # This script is run on our continuous-integration servers to recompile
  18. # from scratch and run the test suite.

  20. # To know the slave's architecture, this script looks at the OCAML_ARCH
  21. # environment variable. For a given node NODE, this variable can be defined
  22. # in Jenkins at the following address:
  23. # https://ci.inria.fr/ocaml/computer/NODE/configure

  25. # Other environment variables that are honored:
  26. #   OCAML_CONFIGURE_OPTIONS   additional options for configure
  27. #   OCAML_JOBS                number of jobs to run in parallel (make -j)

  29. # Command-line arguments:
  30. # -conf configure-option  add configure-option to configure cmd line
  31. # -patch1 file-name       apply patch with -p1
  32. # -no-native              do not build "opt" and "opt.opt"
  33. # -jNN                    pass "-jNN" option to make for parallel builds

  35. ‌error () {
  36.   echo "$1" >&2
  37.   exit 3
  38. }

  40. ‌arch_error() {
  41.   configure_url="https://ci.inria.fr/ocaml/computer/${NODE_NAME}/configure"
  42.   msg="Unknown architecture. Make sure the OCAML_ARCH environment"
  43.   msg="$msg variable has been defined."
  44.   msg="$msg\nSee ${configure_url}"
  45.   error "$msg"
  46. }

  48. # Kill a task on Windows
  49. # Errors are ignored
  50. ‌kill_task()
  51. {
  52.   task=$1
  53.   taskkill /f /im ${task} /t || true
  54. }

  56. ‌quote1 () {
  57.   printf "'%s'" "`printf %s "$1" | sed -e "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"`";
  58. }

  60. #########################################################################
  61. # Display environment information
  62. uname -a
  63. for i in issue redhat-release ; do
  64.   if test -e /etc/$i ; then
  65.     echo "/etc/$i content:"
  66.     cat /etc/$i | sed -e 's/^/| /'
  67.   fi
  68. done
  69. if command -v gcc >/dev/null ; then
  70.   echo "gcc info:"
  71.   gcc --version --verbose 2>&1 | sed -e 's/^/| /'
  72. fi

  74. #########################################################################
  75. # be verbose
  76. set -x

  78. #########################################################################
  79. # Save the current directory (on cygwin, /etc/profile changes it)
  80. jenkinsdir="$(pwd)"
  81. echo jenkinsdir=${jenkinsdir}

  83. #########################################################################
  84. # If we are called from a Windows batch script, we must set up the
  85. # Unix environment variables (e.g. PATH).

  87. case "${OCAML_ARCH}" in
  88.   bsd|macos|linux|solaris) ;;
  89.   cygwin|cygwin64|mingw|mingw64)
  90.    . /etc/profile
  91.    . "$HOME/.profile"
  92.   ;;
  93.   msvc)
  94.    . /etc/profile
  95.    . "$HOME/.profile"
  96.    . "$HOME/.msenv32"
  97.   ;;
  98.   msvc64)
  99.    . /etc/profile
  100.    . "$HOME/.profile"
  101.    . "$HOME/.msenv64"
  102.   ;;
  103.   *) arch_error;;
  104. esac

  106. #########################################################################

  108. # be considerate towards other potential users of the test machine
  109. case "${OCAML_ARCH}" in
  110.   linux) renice 10 $$ ;;
  111. esac

  113. # be verbose and stop on error
  114. set -ex

  116. # On PowerPC, the OCAML_CONFIGURE_OPTIONS is used to specify which C
  117. # compiler to use. However with the introduction of autoconf the way
  118. # to do that has changed. Once all the branches on which we do CI will use
  119. # autoconf, the variable shall be updated on the host. But until then,
  120. # we leave it with its legacy value and override it here.
  121. CCOMP=
  122. case $NODE_NAME in
  123.   ocaml-ppc-32)
  124.     CCOMP="CC='gcc -m32'"
  125.     OCAML_CONFIGURE_OPTIONS=;;
  126.   ocaml-ppc-64)
  127.     CCOMP="CC='gcc -m64'"
  128.     OCAML_CONFIGURE_OPTIONS=;;
  129. esac

  131. #########################################################################
  132. # set up variables

  134. # default values
  135. build=''
  136. host=''
  137. conffile=Makefile.config
  138. make=make
  139. instdir="$HOME/ocaml-tmp-install"
  140. confoptions="--enable-ocamltest --enable-dependency-generation \
  141. ${OCAML_CONFIGURE_OPTIONS}"
  142. make_native=true
  143. cleanup=false
  144. check_make_alldepend=false
  145. jobs=''
  146. bootstrap=false
  147. init_submodule=false

  149. memory_model_tests="tests/memory-model/forbidden.ml \
  150. tests/memory-model/publish.ml"

  152. case "${OCAML_ARCH}" in
  153.   bsd|solaris)
  154.     make=gmake
  155.   ;;
  156.   macos)
  157.     # Nothing special but we must not fall through the "arch_error" case
  158.   ;;
  159.   linux)
  160.     check_make_alldepend=true
  161.   ;;
  162.   cygwin)
  163.     cleanup=true
  164.     check_make_alldepend=true
  165.     export OCAMLTEST_SKIP_TESTS="$memory_model_tests"
  166.   ;;
  167.   cygwin64)
  168.     cleanup=true
  169.     check_make_alldepend=true
  170.     export OCAMLTEST_SKIP_TESTS="$memory_model_tests"
  171.   ;;
  172.   mingw)
  173.     build='--build=i686-pc-cygwin'
  174.     host='--host=i686-w64-mingw32'
  175.     instdir='C:/ocamlmgw'
  176.     cleanup=true
  177.     check_make_alldepend=true
  178.     init_submodule=true
  179.   ;;
  180.   mingw64)
  181.     build='--build=x86_64-pc-cygwin'
  182.     host='--host=x86_64-w64-mingw32'
  183.     instdir='C:/ocamlmgw64'
  184.     cleanup=true
  185.     check_make_alldepend=true
  186.     init_submodule=true
  187.   ;;
  188.   msvc)
  189.     build='--build=i686-pc-cygwin'
  190.     host='--host=i686-pc-windows'
  191.     instdir='C:/ocamlms'
  192.     cleanup=true
  193.   ;;
  194.   msvc64)
  195.     build='--build=x86_64-pc-cygwin'
  196.     host='--host=x86_64-pc-windows'
  197.     instdir='C:/ocamlms64'
  198.     cleanup=true
  199.   ;;
  200.   *) arch_error;;
  201. esac

  203. # Make sure two builds won't use the same install directory
  204. instdir="$instdir-$$"

  206. case "${OCAML_JOBS}" in
  207.   [1-9]|[1-9][0-9]) jobs="-j${OCAML_JOBS}" ;;
  208. esac

  210. #########################################################################
  211. # On Windows, cleanup processes that may remain from previous run

  213. if $cleanup; then
  214.   tasks="tee ocamlrun program ocamltest ocamltest.opt"
  215.   for task in ${tasks}; do kill_task ${task}.exe; done
  216. fi

  218. #########################################################################
  219. # Go to the right directory

  221. pwd
  222. cd "$jenkinsdir"

  224. if $init_submodule; then
  225.   git submodule update --init flexdll
  226. elif [ -f flexdll/Makefile ]; then
  227.   git submodule deinit --force flexdll
  228. fi

  230. #########################################################################
  231. # parse optional command-line arguments (has to be done after the "cd")

  233. while [ $# -gt 0 ]; do
  234.   case $1 in
  235.     -conf) confoptions="$confoptions `quote1 "$2"`"; shift;;
  236.     -patch1) patch -f -p1 <"$2"; shift;;
  237.     -no-native) make_native=false;;
  238.     -j[1-9]|-j[1-9][0-9]) jobs="$1";;
  239.     -with-bootstrap) bootstrap=true;;
  240.     *) error "unknown option $1";;
  241.   esac
  242.   shift
  243. done

  245. #########################################################################
  246. # Do the work

  248. # Tell gcc to use only ASCII in its diagnostic outputs.
  249. export LC_ALL=C

  251. git clean -q -f -d -x

  253. if test "$flambda" = "true"; then
  254.   confoptions="$confoptions --enable-flambda --enable-flambda-invariants"
  255. fi

  257. eval ./configure "$CCOMP" $build $host --prefix='$instdir' $confoptions

  259. grep -q '^NATIVE_COMPILER=false' Makefile.config && make_native=false

  261. if test "$flambda" = "true" && test "$make_native" = "false"; then
  262.   echo "No need to test flambda in a bytecode-only system; skipping the test."
  263.   exit 0
  264. fi

  266. if $bootstrap; then
  267.   $make $jobs --warn-undefined-variables core
  268.   $make $jobs --warn-undefined-variables bootstrap
  269.   if $make_native; then
  270.     $make $jobs --warn-undefined-variables opt.opt
  271.   fi
  272. else
  273.   $make $jobs --warn-undefined-variables
  274. fi


  277. if $make_native && $check_make_alldepend; then
  278.   $make --warn-undefined-variables alldepend
  279. fi

  281. $make --warn-undefined-variables install
  282. rm -rf "$instdir"

  284. cd testsuite
  285. if test -n "$jobs" && test -x /usr/bin/parallel
  286. then PARALLEL="$jobs $PARALLEL" $make --warn-undefined-variables \
  287.                                       SHOW_TIMINGS=1 parallel
  288. else $make --warn-undefined-variables SHOW_TIMINGS=1 all
  289. fi

  291. if $bootstrap; then
  292.   git checkout ../boot/ocamlc ../boot/ocamllex
  293. fi
